intro: Pilosella persica, commonly known as Persian goatweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, white to yellowish flowers and hairy stems and leaves. Native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has a mat-forming growth habit. It is often considered a weed but possesses ecological and potential medicinal significance.
